text.p: The following are some of the leading stories in Finnish papers this morning.

- Central Organisation of Finnish Trade Unions (SAK) chairman Lauri Ihalainen says it was important step when employers vowed on Monday to respect incomes settlement system and accept buffer funds if Finland joins EMU.
- Finance Minister Sauli Niinisto surprised at OKOBANK CEO Antti Tanskanen's comments that his bank may be interested in buying the state's Postipankki. @
- OKOBANK and Postipankki increase their network of automatic banking machines by 100.
- Men's menopause can be treated with hormone plasters, not to cure impotence but to keep testosterone levels normal.
- Spring is breaking out exceptionally early in Finland with early March temperatures at levels reached only a couple of times per century, weathermen say.
- Smoking is one factor causing rheumatism, though a clear link has not been found, researchers say. @
- Enso had the highest operating profit as a portion of net sales of Finland's leading forest industry groups in 1996 -- 10.5 percent compared to 10.1 for UPM-Kymmene and 6.1 percent for Metsa-Serla.

- Pohjola CEO Iiro Viinanen says the group gave enough information to shareholders about restructuring plans including the incorporation of mutual Suomi's portfolio. Its informing process is being probed by the financial supervision. @
- Finland's unemployment problems are structural and the labour market should increase flexibility, says OECD secretary general Donald Johnston visiting Finland.
- Finland is the leading country in electronic banking and seen abroad as a sort of laboratory, says official at Merita where only 10 percent of customers' payments are made over the counters.
- Planned abolition of law regulating auctions may dent industry credibility and there is a risk that stolen goods will flow to auctions, auctioneer says. @
- Some 10,000 farms have been wiped out since Finland joined the EU in 1995 and only 35,000 of the remaining 93,000 farms are investing actively, says official at farmers' lobby MTK.
